title-group.subtitle: An Interdisciplinary, Community-Based Child Weight Management Program

contrib-group.aff: Assistant Professor, Department Head and Associate to the Dean, Nursing, University of Louisiana at Lafayette Lafayette, LA
Assistant Professor, Department Head, Kinesiology, University of Louisiana at Lafayette Lafayette, LA
Assistant Professor, Department of Kinesiology, University of Louisiana at Lafayette Lafayette, LA

fn.p: Dr. Broussard has conducted research on various aspects of school nursing practice. In addition to her faculty role, she works as a school health consultant with the Picard Center for Child Development and Life Long Learning.

Dr. Bryan holds the Vesta R. Bourgeois Endowed Professorship at the University of Louisiana at Lafayette and serves on several national boards including the National Association of Girls and Women in Sports and the American Alliance for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance Research Consortium. Her research interests include child and adolescent fitness and physical activity, motivation and motivational climate in physical education, and coordinated school health initiatives.

Dr. Bellar holds the Patrick Rutherford/BORSF Endowed Professor of Education and is the Director of Human Performance Lab at the University of Louisiana at Lafayette. He is a certified coach having completed the United States of America Track & Field Level II course for the sprints, jumps, and endurance events; he is also a certified strength and conditioning specialist.

ref.citation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (2011a). Basics about childhood obesity. Retrieved from http://www.cdc.gov/obesity/childhood/basics.html
